snippet: The strike by employees of the Bay Area’s main commuter railroad will force hundreds of thousands of people to scramble to find alternate transportation.
abstract: Transit workers for Bay Area Rapid Transit system walk off the job for the second time in three months;  transit system, known as BART, is area’s main commuter railroad, carrying 400,000 passengers daily between the East Bay and San Francisco; union leaders and BART managers emerge from 28 straight hours of negotiation to say they had failed to reach a deal.

byline.contributor: Malia Wollan contributed reporting from Oakland, Calif., and Carol Pogash from San Francisco.

lead_paragraph: The strike by employees of the Bay Area’s main commuter railroad will force hundreds of thousands of people to scramble to find alternate transportation.

headline.main: San Francisco Area Transit Strike Stymies Commuters
headline.print_headline: San Francisco Area Transit Strike Stymies Commuters
